issue.title: Add testing helpers for async projections

milestone.description: No details yet, but wanted the place holder for changes that would require breaking changes

issue.body:
Some of my tests require async projections to be up-to-date in order to be successful.

Let's say I build a test targeting code that queries models created by an async projection:

1. Create stream a predefined set of events
2. Wait for projection to catch up with the events
3. Execute the SUT
4. Assert the right thing™ happened

The second step today is a bit cumbersome.

I tried a suggestion by @oskardudycz using an `IDocumentSessionListener` that writes projection update information to a `System.Threading.Channels.Channel`. Later I could read from the channel, but every event can only be read once. So I needed to cache all information a second time in a `ConcurrentBag`. When asserting whether a (>=1) projection was updated I first inspected the bag and if nothing was found attempted to read from the channel. It kind of worked, but also was unreliable (flaky tests, even with an additional `Thread.Sleep` for good measure) and tedious to define all necessary projections for every integration scenario.

The solution I [currently use](https://gist.github.com/agross/6a9251c415413fe0b365219a6aa1fa99) disables the Async Daemon for testing scenarios and explicitly runs the daemon to update all projections w.r.t. the current event count. It's reliable and works so far.

Since I think that I am not the only person to work with async projections I believe this "wait for everything" to be up-to-date should be generalized and easy to access. Especially it should not require disabling the async daemon for testing scenarios, but rather asking it to be up to date within some timeout. I tried that, but I could not find a way to access the running agent from the `IDocumentStore`.

The APIs that would be helpful:

* `store.WaitForAllAsyncProjections(timeout)`
* `store.WaitForAsyncProjection<TModel>(id, timeout)`
* `store.WaitForAsyncProjection<TModel>(predicate, timeout)`

issue.title: Include documentation on DevOps including database migrations
Group fanouts by id's
issue.body:
Whenever you specify identities like this
```cs
Identities<ConsultationPickedUp>(x => x.PermanentParticipants.Concat(x.DetachedParticipants).ToList());
```
And fanout that event to two different events like this:
```cs
FanOut<ConsultationPickedUp, ConsultationRemovedForUser>(x => 
    x.Data.DetachedParticipants.Select(participantId => new ConsultationRemovedForUser(participantId, x.StreamKey!)));
 FanOut<ConsultationPickedUp, ConsultationPickedUpForUser>(x =>
    x.Data.PermanentParticipants.Select(participantId => new  ConsultationPickedUpForUser(participantId, x.StreamKey!)));
```
but should conditionally map to either one or the other, that is not possible at the moment. So it would ne beneficial to group fanouts to specific identities similair to `void AddEvents<TEvent>(Func<TEvent, TId> singleIdSource, IEnumerable<IEvent> events)` on a custom grouper.

Such as:
```cs
FanOut<ConsultationPickedUp, ConsultationRemovedForUser>(
    x => x.UserId, // group key on fanout event, consistent with ITenantSliceGroup.AddEvents() 
    x => x.Data.DetachedParticipants.Select(participantId => new ConsultationRemovedForUser(participantId, x.StreamKey!))
);
```

issue.title: add mt_created_timestamp field to documents
issue.body: Adds a mt_created_timestamp field and resolves: https://github.com/JasperFx/marten/issues/2740

comment.body:
I've just upgraded to v6.3.0; it's good to see the new mt_created_at field 😄 

I'll clean-up the leftovers.  If you let me know what docs need updating, and it's just a copy from existing last_modified docs, I'll take a look.

issue.title: add mt_created_timestamp field to documents
issue.body: Adds a mt_created_timestamp field and resolves: https://github.com/JasperFx/marten/issues/2740

comment.body:
@ribbal, no worries; I didn't want to discourage or overtake your work. I just wanted to get it into v6.3.0. Which was just released :)

If you see some leftovers, then that would be much appreciated. Also some docs if you're open to that :)

issue.title: add mt_created_timestamp field to documents
issue.body: Adds a mt_created_timestamp field and resolves: https://github.com/JasperFx/marten/issues/2740

comment.body:
> @ribbal, I renamed the initial `CreatedTimestamp` to `CreatedAt` to align it with other field conventions (e.g. `DeletedAt`). I also fixed a few tests.
> 
> I'm pulling it in.
> 
> @ribbal, thanks for the contribution and effort in delivering it 👍

Yeah, I saw that.  I would have been happy to make that change if you would have let me know the naming convention.

There are a few references to 'created_timestamp' still hanging around in the tests.  Shall I fix them, or leave them to you?

release.body:
## 🚀 What's New
* **Added optional metadata column to maintain created timestamp in documents.** Previously, we had the last modified column deleted at, etc. Now you can also track when the document was created by @ribbal in https://github.com/JasperFx/marten/pull/2741
* **Add stream key variants of batched event query operations.** Now you can do batch event queries not only if you use Guids as your stream ids. by @elexisvenator in https://github.com/JasperFx/marten/pull/2742
* **Add `IEvent<TEvent>` fanout overload on multistream projection.** Now you can also define projections' [FanOut](https://martendb.io/events/projections/multi-stream-projections.html#event-fan-out-rules) rules to event with metadata. by @erdtsieck in https://github.com/JasperFx/marten/pull/2748

## ✏️ What's Changed
* **Making DocumentStore implement IAsyncDisposable and drain the tombstone block on dispose async.** That should help in dead letter events queue resiliency by @jeremydmiller in https://github.com/JasperFx/marten/pull/2757, https://github.com/JasperFx/marten/issues/2737
* **Applying the retry policy to opening database connections.** When opening the connection and database got the transient error, the connection was not retried. Now it is. by @jeremydmiller in https://github.com/JasperFx/marten/pull/2758
* **Made AsyncDaemonHealthCheck constructor public to enable proper usage in ASP.NET middleware conventions.** Tweak to properly handle [Async Daemon health checks](https://martendb.io/events/projections/healthchecks.html#async-daemon-healthchecks). by @daveHylde in https://github.com/JasperFx/marten/pull/2727
* **Updated peer dependencies by minor version.** That includes Critter Stack libraries, and also [improved concurrent indexes handling added in Weasel 6.1.2](https://github.com/JasperFx/weasel/releases/tag/6.1.2) by @oskardudycz in https://github.com/JasperFx/marten/pull/2759

## 📄 Docs updates and CI
* **Added initial documentation about integration testing** by @erdtsieck in https://github.com/JasperFx/marten/pull/2732
* **Adjusted information about the column mapping naming convention in Flat Table Projection documentation** by @ogysha in https://github.com/JasperFx/marten/pull/2755
* **Adjusted Async projection test with IoC injection to remove flakiness** by @oskardudycz in https://github.com/JasperFx/marten/pull/2756

## New Contributors
* @ogysha made their first contribution in https://github.com/JasperFx/marten/pull/2755
* @ribbal made their first contribution in https://github.com/JasperFx/marten/pull/2741

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/JasperFx/marten/compare/v6.2.0...v6.3.0
**Milestone:** https://github.com/JasperFx/marten/milestone/102?closed=1

issue.title: Add "Created Timestamp" field to document records
issue.body: Add mt_created_timestamp to all document records to store the timestamp of when the document was first created.  This would be useful for auditing and debugging purposes.

issue.title: Fixes of event type sorting for pattern matching, encapsulating logic in `EventTypePatternMatchFrame`
issue.body:
After upgrade to version 6 some issue have been identified with compilation of generated code.
When a projection depends on events from different levels of the same inheritance chain, the sorting of methods performed during code generation has been found to be non-deterministic.

See more in #2749.

Current PR provides fixes and tests for such scenario.

comment.body: Integration test covering this scenario has been added, please let me know if it meets the expectations.

comment.body: After discussion with @jeremydmiller, still pending providing an integration test for the scenario,  but submitting here for review of implementation and potential consideration for the upcoming 6.3.0 release.
